page.title: 01INTRODUCTION TO AREA.
page.content: The southern half of Block 0316/0861 is almost entirely flat, low-lying, arable farmland. The River Lossie meanders in and out again on the eastern edge. Many ditches and drainage canals criss-cross the land to prevent it becoming water-logged. The Forestry Commission's Nursery at Newton occupies the north-west corner. The wood-covered hill, Quarry Wood, fills the rest of the northern half. A most beautiful stretch of the A96 cuts through this lovely wood. The wood conceals several worked-out sand-stone quarries, gravel pits and ancient earth-works. The area is dotted with farm-houses and steadings with, here and there, larger country mansions. This is a most pleasant place to live and work.
